intro: Seseli bienne subsp. carvifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved seseli, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has a taproot system and produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
